event.title: March 8, 1839, the Town of Kinnikennick was created

data.event: On March 8, 1839, the Town of Kinnikennick was created by the territorial legislature, encompassing the western part of the Town of Lake); and on December 20, 1839, the south portion of the Town of Kinnikennick was split off to form the town of Franklin.

event.title: December 20, 1839, the south portion of the Town of Kinnikennick was split off

data.event: On March 8, 1839, the Town of Kinnikennick was created by the territorial legislature, encompassing the western part of the Town of Lake); and on December 20, 1839, the south portion of the Town of Kinnikennick was split off to form the town of Franklin.

event.title: February 19, 1841, the name of the town was changed

data.event: On February 19, 1841, the name of the town was changed to Greenfield, taking its name from the name of the Post Office in the Town of Kinnickinnic.
Before 1957, Milwaukee slowly nibbled away at Greenfield's land.
